Question 138) The owner of a mechanical workshop needs a piston of the parts of an engine, 68 mm in diameter, to repair a car. To get one, this owner goes to an old iron and finds pistons with diameters equal to 68.21 mm; 68,102 mm; 68.001 mm; 68.02 mm and 68.012 mm.
To put the piston on the engine being fixed, the workshop owner will have to purchase the one that has the closest diameter than it needs.
In this condition, the workshop owner should buy the piston in diameter
A) 68.21 mm.
B) 68,102 mm.
C) 68.02 mm.
D) 68,012 mm.
E) 68.001 mm.
